description: The polymer body of a PMAG magazine.  Currently missing a base plate, which prevents it from being used for its intended purpose.  You can assemble it into a usable magazine if you have an appropriate base plate.

variants.description: The polymer body of a Magpul magazine.  Currently without use because it is missing the base plate, which keeps the spring interior and functional.  Currently missing a base plate, which prevents it from being used for its intended purpose. <variant:black>

//weight: PMAG 10 (3 oz = 85.05 g) - baseplate (9.98 g) = 75.07 g

description: The polymer body of a PMAG magazine.  Currently missing a base plate, which prevents it from being used for its intended purpose.  You can assemble it into a usable magazine if you have an appropriate base plate.

variants.description: The polymer body of a Magpul magazine.  Currently without use because it is missing the base plate, which keeps the spring interior and functional.  Should you find a PMAG base plate or extension, you can assemble the body into a usable magazine.  <variant:black>

description: The aluminum body of a magazine for STANAG-compatible rifles.  Currently missing a base plate, which prevents it from being used for its intended purpose.  You can assemble it into a usable magazine if you have an appropriate base plate.

variants.description: The aluminum body of a magazine for STANAG-compatible rifles.  Currently without use because it is missing the base plate, which keeps the spring interior and functional.  Should you find a PMAG base plate or extension, you can assemble the body into a usable magazine.  <variant:steel>

//weight: Colt mag (4 oz = 113.4 g) - base plate (9.98 g) = 103.42 g
//volume: same volume as the magazine: the base plate is tiny and already fits into the magazine's silhouette
//longest_side: same longest side as the magazine: the base plate is tiny and already fits into the magazine's silhouette
